title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 03, 2019

items.title: Awesome Bioie
items.content_text:
### Code Libraries / Pre-LLM Guides, Lectures, and Courses

*   [Biopython](https://biopython.org/) - [paper](http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btp163) - [code (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/biopython/biopython) - Python tools primarily intended for bioinformatics and computational molecular biology purposes, but also a convenient way to obtain data, including documents/abstracts from PubMed (see Chapter 9 of the documentation).
items.content_html:
Code Libraries / Pre-LLM Guides, Lectures, and Courses

  • Biopython - paper - code (‚≠ê4.7k) - Python tools primarily intended for bioinformatics and computational molecular biology purposes, but also a convenient way to obtain data, including documents/abstracts from PubMed (see Chapter 9 of the documentation).

items.title: Awesome Chrome Devtools
items.content_text:
### Network Inspection

*   [Weer](https://weerdbg.com/) - A HTTP protocol debugger **(closed source)**

### Chrome Debugger integration with Editors

*   [VS Code - Debugger for Chrome (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug/) - Breakpoint debugging in VS Code.
*   [VS Code - Elements for Microsoft Edge (‚≠ê782)](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-edge-devtools) - Elements panel inside VS Code.
*   [ChromeREPL (‚≠ê356)](https://github.com/acarabott/ChromeREPL) - Within Sublime Text, use the Chrome console.
*   [Sublime Web Inspector](http://sokolovstas.github.io/SublimeWebInspector/) - JavaScript Breakpoint debugging right in Sublime Text.
*   [WebStorm/JetBrains Chrome Extension](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/webstorm/2017.1/configuring-javascript-debugger-and-jetbrains-chrome-extension.html) - The WebStorm IDE can debug JavaScript, view the DOM tree, and edit HTML, CSS and JS live.

### Chrome DevTools Protocol

*   [ChromeDevTools/devtools-protocol (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/chromedevtools/devtools-protocol) - **Canonical location of the protocol JSON**. Issue tracker for protocol bugs. TypeScript types.

### Developing with the protocol

*   [chrome-remote-interface Wiki (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/cyrus-and/chrome-remote-interface/wiki) - Many useful recipes.
*   [Chrome Protocol Proxy (‚≠ê219)](https://github.com/wendigo/chrome-protocol-proxy) - Tool for debugging clients using devtools protocol.

### Libraries for driving the protocol (or a layer above)

*   Java: [chrome-devtools-java-client (‚≠ê231)](https://github.com/kklisura/chrome-devtools-java-client)
*   Python: [PyCDP (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/hyperiongray/python-chrome-devtools-protocol) - Pure-Python, sans-IO wrappers. See also the [Trio CDP driver (‚≠ê68)](https://github.com/hyperiongray/trio-chrome-devtools-protocol)
*   Python: [chromewhip (‚≠ê119)](https://github.com/chuckus/chromewhip) - drop-in replacement for the `splash` service
*   Python: [ChromeController (‚≠ê226)](https://github.com/fake-name/ChromeController) - high-level browser mgmt
*   Go: [chromedp (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/chromedp/chromedp) - High-level actions and tasks for driving browsers
*   Go: [cdp (‚≠ê755)](https://github.com/mafredri/cdp)
*   Go: [gcd (‚≠ê185)](https://github.com/wirepair/gcd)
*   Go: [godet (‚≠ê396)](https://github.com/raff/godet)
*   Ruby: [Cuprite (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/machinio/cuprite) - Capybara driver
*   Clojure: [clj-chrome-devtools (‚≠ê131)](https://github.com/tatut/clj-chrome-devtools) - The CDP wrapper API is autogenerated and will be updated when CDP protocol changes.

### Using DevTools frontend with other platforms / Android

*   [j2v8-debugger (‚≠ê92)](https://github.com/AlexTrotsenko/j2v8-debugger) - Debugging JavaScript running in [J2V8 (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/eclipsesource/J2V8) with Chrome DevTools.

### Using DevTools frontend with other platforms / Node.js

*   [ndb (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/ndb) - An improved Node.js debugging experience with the DevTools Frontend.
*   [thetool (‚≠ê222)](https://github.com/sfninja/thetool) - CPU, memory, coverage, type profiling with Node.
*   [chrome-devtools-frontend](https://www.npmjs.com/package/chrome-devtools-frontend) - Mirror of the frontend that ships in Chrome.

### Performance / Ruby

*   [sloth (‚≠ê199)](https://github.com/denar90/sloth) - Chrome extension allows to enable and save CPU and network throttling for selected tabs.
items.content_html:
Network Inspection

  • Weer - A HTTP protocol debugger (closed source)

Chrome Debugger integration with Editors

  • VS Code - Debugger for Chrome (‚≠ê2.2k) - Breakpoint debugging in VS Code.
  • VS Code - Elements for Microsoft Edge (‚≠ê782) - Elements panel inside VS Code.
  • ChromeREPL (‚≠ê356) - Within Sublime Text, use the Chrome console.
  • Sublime Web Inspector - JavaScript Breakpoint debugging right in Sublime Text.
  • WebStorm/JetBrains Chrome Extension - The WebStorm IDE can debug JavaScript, view the DOM tree, and edit HTML, CSS and JS live.

Chrome DevTools Protocol

  • ChromeDevTools/devtools-protocol (‚≠ê1.3k) - Canonical location of the protocol JSON. Issue tracker for protocol bugs. TypeScript types.

Developing with the protocol

  • chrome-remote-interface Wiki (‚≠ê4.4k) - Many useful recipes.
  • Chrome Protocol Proxy (‚≠ê219) - Tool for debugging clients using devtools protocol.

Libraries for driving the protocol (or a layer above)

  • Java: chrome-devtools-java-client (‚≠ê231)
  • Python: PyCDP (‚≠ê115) - Pure-Python, sans-IO wrappers. See also the Trio CDP driver (‚≠ê68)
  • Python: chromewhip (‚≠ê119) - drop-in replacement for the splash service
  • Python: ChromeController (‚≠ê226) - high-level browser mgmt
  • Go: chromedp (‚≠ê12k) - High-level actions and tasks for driving browsers
  • Go: cdp (‚≠ê755)
  • Go: gcd (‚≠ê185)
  • Go: godet (‚≠ê396)
  • Ruby: Cuprite (‚≠ê1.3k) - Capybara driver
  • Clojure: clj-chrome-devtools (‚≠ê131) - The CDP wrapper API is autogenerated and will be updated when CDP protocol changes.

Using DevTools frontend with other platforms / Android

  • j2v8-debugger (‚≠ê92) - Debugging JavaScript running in J2V8 (‚≠ê2.6k) with Chrome DevTools.

Using DevTools frontend with other platforms / Node.js

  • ndb (‚≠ê11k) - An improved Node.js debugging experience with the DevTools Frontend.
  • thetool (‚≠ê222) - CPU, memory, coverage, type profiling with Node.
  • chrome-devtools-frontend - Mirror of the frontend that ships in Chrome.

Performance / Ruby

  • sloth (‚≠ê199) - Chrome extension allows to enable and save CPU and network throttling for selected tabs.

items.title: Awesome Vscode
items.content_text:
### 1C

*   [1C/OScript](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=1c-syntax.language-1c-bsl) - rich 1–°:Enterprise 8 (BSL) language support in VSC - add syntax highlighting to \*.bsl –∏ \*.os files in VSC, add IntelliSense and syntax helper for 1–° lang

### C++

*   [YouCompleteMe](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=RichardHe.you-complete-me) - Provides semantic completions for C/C++ (and TypeScript, JavaScript, Objective-C, Golang, Rust) using [YouCompleteMe](http://ycm-core.github.io/YouCompleteMe/).
items.content_html:
1C

  • 1C/OScript - rich 1–°:Enterprise 8 (BSL) language support in VSC - add syntax highlighting to *.bsl –∏ *.os files in VSC, add IntelliSense and syntax helper for 1–° lang

C++

  • YouCompleteMe - Provides semantic completions for C/C++ (and TypeScript, JavaScript, Objective-C, Golang, Rust) using YouCompleteMe.

items.title: Awesome Postgres
items.content_text:
### Contents / GUI

*   [TablePlus](https://tableplus.com/) - Native App which let you edit database and structure. High-end security ensured (Commercial Software).

### Contents / Optimization

*   [pgMustard](https://www.pgmustard.com/) - A modern user interface
    for `EXPLAIN`, that also provides performance tips (Commercial Software).

### Contents / Utilities

*   [postgres-checkup](https://gitlab.com/postgres-ai/postgres-checkup) - a new-generation diagnostics tool that allows users to collect deep analysis of the health of a Postgres database.

### Resources / Videos

*   [Scaling Postgres](https://www.scalingpostgres.com/) - Postgres video blog series by Creston Jamison
items.content_html:
Contents / GUI

  • TablePlus - Native App which let you edit database and structure. High-end security ensured (Commercial Software).

Contents / Optimization

  • pgMustard - A modern user interface for EXPLAIN, that also provides performance tips (Commercial Software).

Contents / Utilities

  • postgres-checkup - a new-generation diagnostics tool that allows users to collect deep analysis of the health of a Postgres database.

Resources / Videos

  • Scaling Postgres - Postgres video blog series by Creston Jamison

items.title: Awesome Robotics
items.content_text:
### Courses

*   [Underactuated Robotics](http://underactuated.csail.mit.edu/underactuated.html) **MIT CSAIL**
*   [Modern Robotics: Mechanics, Planning, and Control](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/modernrobotics?) **Coursera**
*   [Hello (Real) World with ROS ‚Äì Robot Operating System](https://www.edx.org/course/hello-real-world-with-ros-robot-operating-system-2) **edx**
*   [Advanced Robotics](https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~pabbeel/cs287-fa19/) **UCBerkeley**

### Books

*   [Springer Handbook of Robotics](https://www.amazon.com/Springer-Handbook-Robotics-Handbooks/dp/3319325507/)  :dollar:
*   [Programming Robots with ROS: A Practical Introduction to the Robot Operating System](https://www.amazon.com/Programming-Robots-ROS-Practical-Introduction/dp/1449323898/) :dollar:

### Companies

*   [The construct sim](http://www.theconstructsim.com/)  A cloud based tool for building modern, future-proof robot simulations.

### Related awesome lists

*   [Awesome Gazebo (‚≠ê146)](https://github.com/fkromer/awesome-gazebo)
*   [Awesome ROS2 (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/fkromer/awesome-ros2)
items.content_html:
Courses

  • Underactuated Robotics MIT CSAIL
  • Modern Robotics: Mechanics, Planning, and Control Coursera
  • Hello (Real) World with ROS ‚Äì Robot Operating System edx
  • Advanced Robotics UCBerkeley

Books

  • Springer Handbook of Robotics üíµ

items.title: Awesome Css Frameworks
items.content_text:
### General Purpose

*   [**Cirrus**](https://cirrus-ui.netlify.app/) - Component and utility centric SCSS framework designed for rapid prototyping.\
    ![](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/spiderpig86/Cirrus.svg?style=social\&label=Star)
    [Demo](https://cirrus-ui.netlify.app/getting-started/examples),
    [Docs](https://cirrus-ui.netlify.app/getting-started/setup),
    [Repo (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/Spiderpig86/Cirrus)
    \| #CSS
items.content_html:
General Purpose

  • Cirrus - Component and utility centric SCSS framework designed for rapid prototyping.
    Demo, Docs, Repo (‚≠ê1.4k) | #CSS

items.title: Awesome Python Data Science
items.content_text: ### Distributed Computing / Synthetic Data * [Horovod (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/uber/horovod) - Distributed training framework for TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet. * [PySpark](https://spark.apache.org/docs/0.9.0/python-programming-guide.html) - Exposes the Spark programming model to Python. * [Veles (‚≠ê911)](https://github.com/Samsung/veles) - Distributed machine learning platform. * [Jubatus (‚≠ê707)](https://github.com/jubatus/jubatus) - Framework and Library for Distributed Online Machine Learning. * [DMTK (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/Microsoft/DMTK) - Microsoft Distributed Machine Learning Toolkit. * [dask-ml (‚≠ê940)](https://github.com/dask/dask-ml) - Distributed and parallel machine learning. * [Distributed (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/dask/distributed) - Distributed computation in Python.
items.content_html:
Distributed Computing / Synthetic Data

  • Horovod (‚≠ê15k) - Distributed training framework for TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.
  • PySpark - Exposes the Spark programming model to Python.
  • Veles (‚≠ê911) - Distributed machine learning platform.
  • Jubatus (‚≠ê707) - Framework and Library for Distributed Online Machine Learning.
  • DMTK (‚≠ê2.7k) - Microsoft Distributed Machine Learning Toolkit.
  • dask-ml (‚≠ê940) - Distributed and parallel machine learning.
  • Distributed (‚≠ê1.6k) - Distributed computation in Python.

items.title: Awesome Wagtail
items.content_text:

*   [Wagtail Pipit (‚≠ê246)](https://github.com/Frojd/Wagtail-Boilerplate) ‚Äì Pipit is a Wagtail boilerplate which aims to provide an easy and modern developer workflow with a React-rendered frontend.

Tools / Templates & Starter Kits

  • Wagtail Pipit (‚≠ê246) ‚Äì Pipit is a Wagtail boilerplate which aims to provide an easy and modern developer workflow with a React-rendered frontend.
